lead_paragraph: Mark R. Downs Jr., 29, accused of offering an 8-year-old money to bean an autistic teammate so he could not play, was convicted yesterday in Uniontown, Pa., of corruption of minors and criminal solicitation to commit simple assault. Fayette County authorities said Downs offered to pay a player $25 to hit a 9-year-old autistic teammate with a ball while warming up before a June 2005 playoff game.
